info.description:
Amazon DevOps Guru is a fully managed service that helps you identify anomalous behavior in business critical operational applications. You specify the AWS resources that you want DevOps Guru to cover, then the Amazon CloudWatch metrics and AWS CloudTrail events related to those resources are analyzed. When anomalous behavior is detected, DevOps Guru creates an insight that includes recommendations, related events, and related metrics that can help you improve your operational applications. For more information, see What is Amazon DevOps Guru.

You can specify 1 or 2 Amazon Simple Notification Service topics so you are notified every time a new insight is created. You can also enable DevOps Guru to generate an OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager for each insight to help you manage and track your work addressing insights.

To learn about the DevOps Guru workflow, see How DevOps Guru works. To learn about DevOps Guru concepts, see Concepts in DevOps Guru.
info.title: Amazon DevOps Guru

servers.description: The Amazon DevOps Guru multi-region endpoint
The Amazon DevOps Guru multi-region endpoint
The Amazon DevOps Guru endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The Amazon DevOps Guru endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description: For the time range passed in, returns the number of open reactive insight that were created, the number of open proactive insights that were created, and the Mean Time to Recover (MTTR) for all closed reactive insights.

ToTime.description: The end of the time range passed in. The start time granularity is at the day level. The floor of the start time is used. Returned information occurred before this day. If this is not specified, then the current day is used.

FromTime.description: The start of the time range passed in. The start time granularity is at the day level. The floor of the start time is used. Returned information occurred after this day.

post.description:
Returns a list of insights in your AWS account. You can specify which insights are returned by their start time, one or more statuses (ONGOING, CLOSED, and CLOSED), one or more severities (LOW, MEDIUM, and HIGH), and type (REACTIVE or PROACTIVE).

Use the Filters parameter to specify status and severity search parameters. Use the Type parameter to specify REACTIVE or PROACTIVE in your search.

Filters.description: Specifies one or more severity values and one or more status values that are used to search for insights.

allOf.description: A collection of the names of AWS services.
An array of status values used to search for insights.
An array of severity values used to search for insights.

Type.description: The type of insights you are searching for (REACTIVE or PROACTIVE).

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

StartTimeRange.description: A time range used to specify when the behavior of an insight or anomaly started.

allOf.description: The end time of the time range.
The start time of the time range.

get.description: Returns details about an insight that you specify using its ID.

post.description: Returns a list of the events emitted by the resources that are evaluated by DevOps Guru. You can use filters to specify which events are returned.

Filters.description: Filters you can use to specify which events are returned when ListEvents is called.

allOf.description: The class of the events you want to filter for, such as an infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema change.
The AWS source that emitted the events you want to filter for.
A time range during which you want the filtered events to have occurred.
An ID of an insight that is related to the events you want to filter for.
The source, AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL or AWS_CODE_DEPLOY, of the events you want returned.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

post.description: Returns a list of insights in your AWS account. You can specify which insights are returned by their start time and status (ONGOING, CLOSED, or ANY).

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve the remaining results, make another call with the returned nextToken value.

StatusFilter.description: A filter used by ListInsights to specify which insights to return.

allOf.description: A ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter that specifies closed insights that are either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE.
A ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter that specifies ongoing insights that are either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE.
A ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter that specifies insights of any status that are either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE.

delete.description: Removes a notification channel from DevOps Guru. A notification channel is used to notify you when DevOps Guru generates an insight that contains information about how to improve your operations.

parameters.description: The ID of the notification channel to be removed.
parameters.name: Id

get.description: Returns an estimate of the monthly cost for DevOps Guru to analyze your AWS resources. For more information, see Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs and Amazon DevOps Guru pricing.

parameters.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
parameters.name: NextToken

put.description: Starts the creation of an estimate of the monthly cost to analyze your AWS resources.

ClientToken.description: The idempotency token used to identify each cost estimate request.

ResourceCollection.description: Information about a filter used to specify which AWS resources are analyzed to create a monthly DevOps Guru cost estimate. For more information, see Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs and Amazon DevOps Guru pricing.

allOf.description: An object that specifies the CloudFormation stack that defines the AWS resources used to create a monthly estimate for DevOps Guru.

put.description:
Adds a notification channel to DevOps Guru. A notification channel is used to notify you about important DevOps Guru events, such as when an insight is generated.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications. DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information, see Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add permissions to the CMK. For more information, see Permissions for AWS KMS?encrypted Amazon SNS topics.

Config.description: Information about notification channels you have configured with DevOps Guru. The one supported notification channel is Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

allOf.description:
Information about a notification channel configured in DevOps Guru to send notifications when insights are created.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications. DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information, see Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add permissions to the CMK. For more information, see Permissions for AWS KMS?encrypted Amazon SNS topics.

post.description: Returns a list of notification channels configured for DevOps Guru. Each notification channel is used to notify you when DevOps Guru generates an insight that contains information about how to improve your operations. The one supported notification channel is Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

get.description: Returns the number of open reactive insights, the number of open proactive insights, and the number of metrics analyzed in your AWS account. Use these numbers to gauge the health of operations in your AWS account.

Returns the number of open proactive insights, open reactive insights, and the Mean Time to Recover (MTTR) for all closed insights in resource collections in your account. You specify the type of AWS resources collection. The one type of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

parameters.description: An AWS resource collection type. This type specifies how analyzed AWS resources are defined. The one type of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.
parameters.name: ResourceCollectionType

parameters.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
parameters.name: NextToken

get.description: Returns details about an anomaly that you specify using its ID.

put.description: Collects customer feedback about the specified insight.

InsightFeedback.description: Information about insight feedback received from a customer.

allOf.description: The feedback provided by the customer.
The insight feedback ID.

post.description: Returns the most recent feedback submitted in the current AWS account and Region.

InsightId.description: The ID of the insight for which the feedback was provided.

post.description: Returns a list of a specified insight's recommendations. Each recommendation includes a list of related metrics and a list of related events.

Locale.description: A locale that specifies the language to use for recommendations.

NextToken.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.

InsightId.description: The ID of the requested insight.

get.description: Returns lists AWS resources that are of the specified resource collection type. The one type of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

parameters.description: The type of AWS resource collections to return. The one valid value is CLOUD_FORMATION for AWS CloudFormation stacks.
parameters.name: ResourceCollectionType

parameters.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If this value is null, it retrieves the first page.
parameters.name: NextToken

put.description: Updates the collection of resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. The one type of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks. This method also creates the IAM role required for you to use DevOps Guru.

Action.description: Specifies if the resource collection in the request is added or deleted to the resource collection.

ResourceCollection.description: Contains information used to update a collection of AWS resources.

allOf.description: An collection of AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

get.description: Returns the integration status of services that are integrated with DevOps Guru. The one service that can be integrated with DevOps Guru is AWS Systems Manager, which can be used to create an OpsItem for each generated insight.

put.description: Enables or disables integration with a service that can be integrated with DevOps Guru. The one service that can be integrated with DevOps Guru is AWS Systems Manager, which can be used to create an OpsItem for each generated insight.

ServiceIntegration.description: Information about updating the integration status of an AWS service, such as AWS Systems Manager, with DevOps Guru.

post.description: Returns a list of the anomalies that belong to an insight that you specify using its ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the insight. The returned anomalies belong to this insight.
parameters.name: InsightId

CloudWatchMetricsDimension.description: The dimension of a Amazon CloudWatch metric that is used when DevOps Guru analyzes the resources in your account for operational problems and anomalous behavior. A dimension is a name/value pair that is part of the identity of a metric. A metric can have up to 10 dimensions. For more information, see Dimensions in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

allOf.description: The value of the CloudWatch dimension.
The name of the CloudWatch dimension.

Event.description: An AWS resource event. AWS resource events and metrics are analyzed by DevOps Guru to find anomalous behavior and provide recommendations to improve your operational solutions.

allOf.description: The class of the event. The class specifies what the event is related to, such as an infrastructure change, a deployment, or a schema change.
The AWS source that emitted the event.
A Timestamp that specifies the time the event occurred.
The ID of the event.
An EventResource object that contains information about the resource that emitted the event.
The name of the event.
The source, AWS_CLOUD_TRAIL or AWS_CODE_DEPLOY, where DevOps Guru analysis found the event.

CloudFormationCostEstimationResourceColl.description: Information about an AWS CloudFormation stack used to create a monthly cost estimate for DevOps Guru to analyze AWS resources. The maximum number of stacks you can specify for a cost estimate is one. The estimate created is for the cost to analyze the AWS resources defined by the stack. For more information, see Stacks in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

allOf.description: An array of CloudFormation stack names. Its size is fixed at 1 item.

ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter.description: Used to filter for insights that have any status.

allOf.description: Use to filter for either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE insights.
A time range used to specify when the behavior of the filtered insights started.

AnomalyReportedTimeRange.description: A time range that specifies when DevOps Guru opens and then closes an anomaly. This is different from AnomalyTimeRange, which specifies the time range when DevOps Guru actually observes the anomalous behavior.

allOf.description: The time when an anomaly is opened.
The time when an anomaly is closed.

The end of the time range passed in. The start time granularity is at the day level. The floor of the start time is used. Returned information occurred before this day. If this is not specified, then the current day is used.
The start of the time range passed in. The start time granularity is at the day level. The floor of the start time is used. Returned information occurred after this day.

allOf.description: The status of the proactive insight.
The severity of the proactive insight.
The ID of the proactive insight.
The name of the proactive insight.
The ID of the AWS System Manager OpsItem created for this insight. You must enable the creation of OpstItems insights before they are created for each insight.

ListInsightsStatusFilter.description: A filter used by ListInsights to specify which insights to return.

allOf.description: A ListInsightsClosedStatusFilter that specifies closed insights that are either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE.
A ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter that specifies ongoing insights that are either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE.
A ListInsightsAnyStatusFilter that specifies insights of any status that are either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE.

RecommendationRelatedEventResource.description: Information about an AWS resource that emitted and event that is related to a recommendation in an insight.

allOf.description: The type of the resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to the Type field in an EventResource object.
The name of the resource that emitted the event. This corresponds to the Name field in an EventResource object.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
The returned reactive insights.
The returned proactive insights.

allOf.description: An array of CloudWatchMetricsDetail objects that contains information about the analyzed metrics that displayed anomalous behavior.

RecommendationRelatedAnomaly.description: Information about an anomaly that is related to a recommendation.

allOf.description: An array of objects that represent resources in which DevOps Guru detected anomalous behavior. Each object contains the name and type of the resource.
Information about where the anomalous behavior related the recommendation was found. For example, details in Amazon CloudWatch metrics.

ResourceCollectionFilter.description: Information about a filter used to specify which AWS resources are analyzed for anomalous behavior by DevOps Guru.

allOf.description: Information about AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can use up to 500 stacks to specify which AWS resources in your account to analyze. For more information, see Stacks in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

ServiceResourceCost.description: An object that contains information about the estimated monthly cost to analyze an AWS resource. For more information, see Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs and Amazon DevOps Guru pricing.

allOf.description: The price per hour to analyze the resources in the service. For more information, see Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs and Amazon DevOps Guru pricing.
The type of the AWS resource.

The state of the resource. The resource is ACTIVE if it produces metrics, events, or logs within an hour, otherwise it is INACTIVE. You pay for the number of active AWS resource hours analyzed for each resource. Inactive resources are not charged.
The number of active resources analyzed for this service to create a monthly cost estimate.
The total estimated monthly cost to analyze the active resources for this resource.

RecommendationRelatedAnomalyResource.description: Information about a resource in which DevOps Guru detected anomalous behavior.

allOf.description: The type of the resource.
The name of the resource.
Specifies if the resource collection in the request is added or deleted to the resource collection.

allOf.description: The status of a proactive anomaly.
A AnomalyReportedTimeRange object that specifies the time range between when the anomaly is opened and the time when it is closed.
The time of the anomaly's most recent update.
The ID of the insight that contains this anomaly. An insight is composed of related anomalies.
The severity of a proactive anomaly.
The ID of a proactive anomaly.
A threshold that was exceeded by behavior in analyzed resources. Exceeding this threshold is related to the anomalous behavior that generated this anomaly.
Details about the source of the analyzed operational data that triggered the anomaly. The one supported source is Amazon CloudWatch metrics.

allOf.description: The end time of the time range.
The start time of the time range.

NotificationChannelConfig.description: Information about notification channels you have configured with DevOps Guru. The one supported notification channel is Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

allOf.description:
Information about a notification channel configured in DevOps Guru to send notifications when insights are created.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications. DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information, see Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add permissions to the CMK. For more information, see Permissions for AWS KMS?encrypted Amazon SNS topics.

InsightTimeRange.description: A time ranged that specifies when the observed behavior in an insight started and ended.

allOf.description: The time when the behavior described in an insight ended.
The time when the behavior described in an insight started.

allOf.description: The status of the anomaly.

allOf.description: The type of resource that emitted an event.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that emitted an event.
The name of the resource that emitted an event.

Recommendation.description: Recommendation information to help you remediate detected anomalous behavior that generated an insight.

allOf.description: A description of the problem.
Events that are related to the problem. Use these events to learn more about what's happening and to help address the issue.
A hyperlink to information to help you address the problem.
The reason DevOps Guru flagged the anomalous behavior as a problem.
The name of the recommendation.
Anomalies that are related to the problem. Use these Anomalies to learn more about what's happening and to help address the issue.

SnsChannelConfig.description:
Contains the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Simple Notification Service topic.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications. DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information, see Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add permissions to the CMK. For more information, see Permissions for AWS KMS?encrypted Amazon SNS topics.

CloudFormationCollection.description: Information about AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can use up to 500 stacks to specify which AWS resources in your account to analyze. For more information, see Stacks in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

allOf.description: An array of CloudFormation stack names.
The idempotency token used to identify each cost estimate request.
The collection of AWS resources used to create a monthly DevOps Guru cost estimate.
The status of creating this cost estimate. If it's still in progress, the status ONGOING is returned. If it is finished, the status COMPLETED is returned.
The estimated monthly cost to analyze the AWS resources. This value is the sum of the estimated costs to analyze each resource in the Costs object in this response.

An array of ResourceCost objects that each contains details about the monthly cost estimate to analyze one of your AWS resources.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
The collection of the AWS resources used to create your monthly DevOps Guru cost estimate.
A ProactiveAnomaly object that represents the requested anomaly.
A ReactiveAnomaly object that represents the requested anomaly.

ResourceCollection.description: A collection of AWS resources supported by DevOps Guru. The one type of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

allOf.description: An array of the names of AWS CloudFormation stacks. The stacks define AWS resources that DevOps Guru analyzes. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.
The Mean Time to Recover (MTTR) for all closed insights that were created during the time range passed in.
An integer that specifies the number of open reactive insights in your AWS account that were created during the time range passed in.
An integer that specifies the number of open proactive insights in your AWS account that were created during the time range passed in.

InsightHealth.description: Information about the number of open reactive and proactive insights that can be used to gauge the health of your system.

allOf.description: The Meant Time to Recover (MTTR) for the insight.
The number of open reactive insights.
The number of open proactive insights.

ServiceHealth.description: Represents the health of an AWS service.

allOf.description: The name of the AWS service.
Represents the health of an AWS service. This is a ServiceInsightHealth that contains the number of open proactive and reactive insights for this service.

CostEstimationResourceCollectionFilter.description: Information about a filter used to specify which AWS resources are analyzed to create a monthly DevOps Guru cost estimate. For more information, see Estimate your Amazon DevOps Guru costs and Amazon DevOps Guru pricing.

allOf.description: An object that specifies the CloudFormation stack that defines the AWS resources used to create a monthly estimate for DevOps Guru.

ProactiveInsightSummary.description: Details about a proactive insight. This object is returned by DescribeInsight.

allOf.description: The status of the proactive insight.
A collection of the names of AWS services.
The severity of the proactive insight.
The ID of the proactive insight.
The name of the proactive insight.

ReactiveInsightSummary.description: Information about a reactive insight. This object is returned by DescribeInsight.

allOf.description: The status of a reactive insight.
A collection of the names of AWS services.
The severity of a reactive insight.
The ID of a reactive summary.
The name of a reactive insight.

OpsCenterIntegrationConfig.description: Information about whether DevOps Guru is configured to create an OpsItem in AWS Systems Manager OpsCenter for each created insight.

allOf.description: Specifies if DevOps Guru is enabled to create an AWS Systems Manager OpsItem for each created insight.

EventTimeRange.description: The time range during which an AWS event occurred. AWS resource events and metrics are analyzed by DevOps Guru to find anomalous behavior and provide recommendations to improve your operational solutions.

allOf.description: The time when the event ended.
The time when the event started.

NotificationChannel.description:
Information about a notification channel. A notification channel is used to notify you when DevOps Guru creates an insight. The one supported notification channel is Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

If you use an Amazon SNS topic in another account, you must attach a policy to it that grants DevOps Guru permission to it notifications. DevOps Guru adds the required policy on your behalf to send notifications using Amazon SNS in your account. For more information, see Permissions for cross account Amazon SNS topics.

If you use an Amazon SNS topic that is encrypted by an AWS Key Management Service customer-managed key (CMK), then you must add permissions to the CMK. For more information, see Permissions for AWS KMS?encrypted Amazon SNS topics.

allOf.description: A NotificationChannelConfig object that contains information about configured notification channels.
The ID of a notification channel.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
The returned list of reactive insights.
The returned list of proactive insights.
An integer that specifies the number of open reactive insights in your AWS account.
An integer that specifies the number of metrics that have been analyzed in your AWS account.
The number of Amazon DevOps Guru resource analysis hours billed to the current AWS account in the last hour.
An integer that specifies the number of open proactive insights in your AWS account.

RecommendationRelatedEvent.description: Information about an event that is related to a recommendation.

allOf.description: A ResourceCollection object that contains arrays of the names of AWS CloudFormation stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.
The name of the event. This corresponds to the Name field in an Event object.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
A list of the requested events.
An IntegratedServiceConfig object used to specify the integrated service you want to update, and whether you want to update it to enabled or disabled.

ServiceInsightHealth.description: Contains the number of open proactive and reactive insights in an analyzed AWS service.

allOf.description: The number of open reactive insights in the AWS service
The number of open proactive insights in the AWS service
An array of ReactiveAnomalySummary objects that represent the requested anomalies
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.
An array of ProactiveAnomalySummary objects that represent the requested anomalies

ListInsightsOngoingStatusFilter.description: Used to filter for insights that have the status ONGOING.

allOf.description: Use to filter for either REACTIVE or PROACTIVE insights.
The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

The requested list of AWS resource collections. The one type of AWS resource collection supported is AWS CloudFormation stacks. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze only the AWS resources that are defined in the stacks. You can specify up to 500 AWS CloudFormation stacks.

InsightFeedback.description: Information about insight feedback received from a customer.

allOf.description: The feedback provided by the customer.
The insight feedback ID.
